about.title: About Costa Rica Tree Atlas
about.subtitle: An open-source project documenting the magnificent trees of Costa Rica

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: The Costa Rica Tree Atlas is dedicated to creating a comprehensive, accessible, and bilingual resource documenting the remarkable trees found throughout Costa Rica. We believe that knowledge about native flora is essential for conservation, education, and fostering a deeper appreciation for the natural world.

bilingual.title: Bilingual Content
bilingual.description: All content is available in both English and Spanish, making this resource accessible to a wider audience.

comprehensive.title: Comprehensive Profiles
comprehensive.description: Each tree species includes detailed information about botany, ecology, uses, cultural significance, and conservation status.

scientific.title: Scientific Accuracy
scientific.description: Content is researched from authoritative sources including scientific literature, botanical institutions, and field observations.

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: This project is fully open source. Anyone can contribute new tree profiles, corrections, translations, or code improvements.

whyCostaRica.title: Why Costa Rica?
whyCostaRica.description: Despite being only 0.03% of Earth's surface, Costa Rica contains nearly 5% of the world's biodiversity. This remarkable concentration of life makes it one of the most important places on Earth for conservation and biological research.

contributing.title: How to Contribute
contributing.description: We welcome contributions from botanists, naturalists, photographers, developers, and anyone passionate about Costa Rica's trees. Whether you want to add a new tree profile, improve existing content, translate material, or enhance the website, your help is valued.

acknowledgments.title: Acknowledgments
acknowledgments.description: This project would not be possible without the wealth of knowledge shared by researchers, institutions, and community scientists:
acknowledgments.inaturalist: iNaturalist community for observation data and photography
acknowledgments.sinac: SINAC (Costa Rica's National System of Conservation Areas) for conservation information
acknowledgments.community: The global community of botanists and ecologists researching tropical trees

license.title: Open Source License
license.description: Costa Rica Tree Atlas is released under the MIT License. The content is free to use, share, and adapt with attribution.

education.title: Educational Resources
education.subtitle: Free lesson plans, activities, and materials for teaching about Costa Rica's trees and forest ecosystems

intro.title: For Teachers and Educators
intro.description: These educational resources are designed to help teachers integrate Costa Rica's rich biodiversity into their curriculum. All materials are free to use and adapt for educational purposes, available in both English and Spanish.

biodiversity-intro.title: Introduction to Biodiversity
biodiversity-intro.description: Students explore what biodiversity means and why Costa Rica is one of the most biodiverse places on Earth.
biodiversity-intro.objective1: Define biodiversity and explain its importance
biodiversity-intro.objective2: Identify at least 5 native Costa Rican tree species

tree-identification.title: Tree Identification Skills
tree-identification.description: Learn to identify trees using leaves, bark, flowers, and fruits through hands-on observation.
tree-identification.objective1: Use a dichotomous key to identify tree species
tree-identification.objective2: Describe key features that distinguish different trees

conservation.title: Conservation and Threats
conservation.description: Understand the threats facing tropical forests and the conservation efforts protecting them.
conservation.objective1: Analyze human impacts on tropical forest ecosystems
conservation.objective2: Evaluate conservation strategies and their effectiveness

ecosystem-services.title: Ecosystem Services
ecosystem-services.description: Discover how trees provide essential services like clean air, water filtration, and habitat.
ecosystem-services.objective1: List ecosystem services provided by tropical trees
ecosystem-services.objective2: Calculate the value of ecosystem services in a given area

tree-journal.title: Tree Journal
tree-journal.description: Students adopt a local tree and document its changes throughout the school year.

scavenger-hunt.title: Tree Scavenger Hunt
scavenger-hunt.description: Teams search for trees matching specific characteristics from the atlas.

leaf-collection.title: Leaf Collection
leaf-collection.description: Create a pressed leaf collection and identify species using the atlas.

compare-contrast.title: Compare & Contrast
compare-contrast.description: Use the comparison tool to analyze similarities and differences between species.

printables.title: Printable Resources
printables.description: Download and print these resources for classroom use. All materials are free for educational purposes.

tips.title: Using the Atlas in Your Classroom

explore.title: Explore the Directory
explore.description: Browse trees by family, conservation status, or characteristics. Use the A-Z index for alphabetical exploration.

identify.title: Try Tree Identification
identify.description: Take photos during field trips and use the identification feature to find matching species in the atlas.

compare.title: Compare Species
compare.description: Use the comparison tool to display multiple trees side-by-side and analyze their differences.

cta.title: Ready to Start?
cta.description: Explore our collection of Costa Rican trees or try our tree identification feature with your students.

seasonal.title: Seasonal Calendar - Costa Rica Tree Atlas
seasonal.description: Discover when Costa Rica's trees flower and fruit throughout the year. Plan your nature visits with our phenological calendar.
seasonal.pageDescription: Discover when Costa Rica's trees are flowering and fruiting throughout the year.
seasonal.climateDescription: Costa Rica has two main seasons that influence tree flowering and fruiting patterns. The dry season triggers many species to flower, while the wet season supports fruit development.
seasonal.drySeasonNote: Peak flowering season for many species. Many deciduous trees lose their leaves and produce spectacular blooms.
seasonal.wetSeasonNote: Primary fruiting season. Abundant rainfall supports fruit development and dispersal by animals.
